alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 8:27AM CDT until July 10 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River at Purcell affecting McClain, Pottawatomie and Cleveland Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Canadian River at Purcell. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Near bankfull levels occur along the river on the Cleveland-McClain County border from near Noble... to areas south of Purcell and Lexington. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 11.5 feet this evening. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM CDT.
